content: The Act is titled the "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for various terms used within the Act. The Act, titled the "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act," defines key terms such as "Authority" as the Southern Nevada Water Authority, "Griffith Project" as the Robert B. Griffith Water Project, "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior, and "Acquired Land(s)" as interests in land acquired by the United States. The Griffith Project involves acquiring fee title, right(s)-of-way, and easement(s) from non-Federal sources for lands under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Land Management. Public Land refers to lands under Federal ownership, while Withdrawn Land are Federal lands reserved for specific public purposes. The Griffith Project involves acquiring fee title, right(s)-of-way, and easement(s) from non-Federal sources for lands under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Land Management. Public Land refers to lands under Federal ownership, while Withdrawn Land are Federal lands reserved for specific public purposes. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE OF GRIFFITH PROJECT. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project from the United States upon prepayment of $121,204,348. The Secretary will convey all rights, titles, and interests in project improvements, acquired lands, and reserved interests to the Authority. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project from the United States upon prepayment of $121,204,348. The Secretary will convey all rights, titles, and interests in project improvements, acquired lands, and reserved interests to the Authority. The Authority shall have a right-of-way across Public Land and Federal lands necessary for the operation and maintenance of the Griffith Project without payment of rental fees. Within twelve months, the Secretary and the Authority will agree on the land subject to the established rights-of-way. The Secretary will deliver a document to the Authority memorializing the rights-of-way. If the conveyance does not occur within twelve months, a report on the status will be submitted to Congress. The Secretary and the Authority may modify existing contracts and permits to comply with this Act. This Act does not affect other laws or future benefits. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, it will no longer receive Reclamation benefits and will cease to be a Federal Reclamation Project. Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area associated lands will not be affected. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area associated lands will not be affected. The United States shall not be liable for damages arising from its prior ownership of the conveyed property under applicable legislation.
